result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark W Monson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark W Monson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Mark W Monson in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.
30 days RCJ to run conc to 14CM2789;
cc are waived

  ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Mark W Monson in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
